Assumption

Next few chapters : Kise will confess his feeling to Amuro. She will reject him. Probably saying something that I have someone I like / I have a boyfriend. 

He won't give up. Starts to stalking her / something then he found out that she's dating sensei. He blackmailed her. Amuro can't say no because if everyone knows their relationship, it will ruin sensei's future. She agreed to have sex with him.

While still doing it with Kistrash, Sensei will notice something strange from Amuro. Like she doesn't have energy to have sex with him, or maybe some hickeys or some shit. 

Their relationship goes dark. 

And then at some point, she goes down deeper. By doing AV. Like the one we see at this series cover.

Just get on with the cheating sex so that I will not keep my hopes up everytime I wait for an update. Seems like with the way he acts in bed and the way he talks to her/the looks on his face that the teacher is going to be the instigator for any cheating. Which is good, because then I don't have to get sad because the girl has plenty of other available options, so fuck the teacher

It's rarefure all over again. The difference is that in rarefure the deed is shown clearly but here it's in the form of mc imagination or possibly foreshadow / hint of reality that it's actually happened. 

Rarefure didn't hurt me because I have no attachment to those Chara but Itaiamai is different. Lots of hints dropped by author makes me overthinking. It sucks. Coupled by the slow release and snail-paced plot
It's over :((( can't wait for chapter 11!!

Ok so I went back and skimmed all the ChPs and 3,4,5,6,7 were the only that hinted at ntr but then again we don’t exactly know just yet she might of planned that all out just to scare mc and never actually did the deed since it never showed I only say this because of what she said In chp5 about the picture of how her and mc met and what meaning it meant to mc and I don’t think a girl would literally sell herself right after loosing her v card to mc just like that I’d like to hear what everyone else thinks

Question for anyone ( does the female teacher that’s always recording have a role in the series at all cuz if we go back to chp9 it seems like she saw something at the very last few pages and if we go with what she said in chP 10 she might of seen something maybe not again mc but at the same time she probably did since he and trashkise were next to Karin I myself thought that she recorded something that can be used against mc as blackmail or to help him save Karin or something but if you go back and check she don’t even have her camera anymore/recorder and I think she’s wearing a mask idk I’d appreciate it if someone answered

@satsujin That's a very good take actually. I personally have been in these kinds of long waits for lots of other doujins and even eroges so many times now so waiting for new chapters to slowly trickle monthly is nothing to me now. But yeah, I could see how what you said might be why people would think these first 10 chapters looked like the author is dragging the story. I mean, it took exactly 14 months (monthly releases with 4 months of no releases if i counted correctly) just to get to where we are right now. Also apparently, many people are like on the waiting room waiting to see if the story's gonna go south at some point or not. Mustve been a long dreading wait, huh. Having all that said,  I think it's a good experience for people to have. Reading works like this where the story is actually cooked in front of our eyes first before hitting our stomachs is pretty nice. The long wait actually gives people more chances to drop the series if they couldn't bear it anymore.

@DrinksandDame ------>cont most realistic would be gravure root simply because it have most flags. Overall it means that we would reach end of story only on year or even two or three in worst case from now and, as I say, reading it so long is frustrating.
P.S. sorry for bad english, not my native language

@DrinksandDame I think problem is not in the story itself (which is good for NTR-hentai, as I think), but in monthly magazine scedule. Add that author often breaks from scedule (it was 3 or 4 times for year I suppose) and we have situation where manga is ongoing nearly a year but we have only a little plot progression after all. In other words we have entire year of setup and plot (slowly) starting to progress only now. Stories with long setup are good, especially with NTR, but reading it during ongoing publication just frustrating. So far we have setup for 4 roots (1 vanilla + 3 NTR), but zero plot. As far as I can judge from pacing, number of characters and possible roots, it's easily plot for 30-40 chapters: only school root can be 10 chapters and we still have part-time work and gravure root. Also author can warp it pretty quickly if needed, but it's anyway 20 chapters at least even if school root will be main, which as I think, not the case - most realistic would be

@anonymous_never-watchhentai Here it is: https://pastebin.com/WzbrVvuz  Tbh it's just a very simplifed summary so don't expect that much of a big difference from what you've read lol. @HentaiKingTestamentBasara Feel free to read this too so you can see where I'm coming from. As someone who hopes that this will be diff form other work of the author, FUCK
@DrinksandDame I’d like to hear all the plot points I missed and I would also like to know why the guy in this chP wants the mc to assault his girl

@HentaiKingTestamentBasara But in those chapters that you seem to be pertaining to, we get to be introduced to new characters or we at least get some hints on what could possibly happen in future chapters. We're literally like in the first 10 chapters of a who knows how long of a series so you should expect that much especially since this one's more story driven than you're usual doujins. But of course, that doesn't change the fact that the first few chapters were quite slow in pace and some scenes were repetitive in concept. Still, I don't think that's enough to call it milking when the story's still building up and introducing the world and its characters. Anyway,  I could detail to you what new significant plotpoints we got every chapter in case you missed them back when you read the previous chapters. Just ask.

If you guys read it properly you'll realise that the text message "sorry I won't be able to make it today " was sent by amuro just before she was kissed by  kise  .. so don't think too much about it and look forward to the next chapter ...also the title is itaiamai (sweetpain /sweet and painful) , so the author is doing a good job in making this story sweet (amai) by giving us wholesome scenes with teacher and also giving us ntr baits to make it painful (itai)  ...hence itaiamai , props to the author for sticking perfectly to the title 😅
I'm still curious about this series cover. Amuro will definitely playing in AV. Either that or she's screwing with someone else after some misunderstanding shit with mc.

@ryushiki Hinamix was actually a work he started way back in 2016 (6 years ago). It just so happens that someone commissioned for its translation now. But since his most recent completed work was actually story driven and not like Hinamix where the characters were pretty much just having fun with sex, It's more likely that he'll focus the story in Itaiamai as well. Also, Rarefure sold well so there's that too. Could still be wrong tho.
Thank god no ntr yet
Damn upcoming chapters looking so exciting :)

@Smolinko I couldn't quite understand what you tried to say there. Anyway, tags don't matter. You're reading the doujin, not the tags. Right now it doesn't have any unwholesome tags, but if reading these chapters already makes you end up only complaining after because it has things that you don't like or you simply don't like where the story is going, I'd say those are valid reasons enough to drop this one already. Don't be a masochist and force yourself to wait for 1-2 months for new chapters only to end up seeing shit you hate. There's more doujins out there for you read and enjoy.  Also, take note that this work's title is Itaiamai which is a combination of the work "painful" and "sweet". You should already know what you're hopping into.
If you're Vanilla Fan,don't ever read his work.
Then again, that Hinix garbage series of his ain’t doing much to provide me much confidence tbh
Y’all did the same freaking out last chapter and they’re still fine together. Really doubt it’s going down the NTR route and y’all are just hypersensitive or hoping it comes to be
@DrinksandDame And even to stay away from it if the NTR tag isn't there

@Smolinko im not the person you replied to but I want to point out that the mistake you're making is assuming that this is work "should be wholesome". That's why when this author puts some non-wholesome elements in it, you're quick to judge that the author is "forcing it" to the story. That's just wrong. The author is free to write his story the way he wants and similarly, you are free to stay away from works that have elements that you don't like. Simple as that.

@Blankroom If you're fetised to have your girlfriend/wife fuck someone else, go ahead and masturbate. You accept that there are people who, reading the story, do not want to read that the writer is forcing the NTR genre into the work that shouldn't be
I'm still holding strong on the "Amuro will flip out, ruin his life and lose his girl because he doesn't trust her" idea, it's not NTR, it's "don't trust and you lose love" whatever that is.

@nhcasual Writing a somewhat properly paced story with decently fleshed out characters and mix of wholesome then serious moments =/= milking a work for the long run. Im sorry but I keep seeing that you're showing your disappointment of this work by relating it to Rarefure when clearly, both works were set to have a long story from the start (introducing several characters and leaving them off for later on to have their relevance to the story). About that "introducing NTR later on to the story when author gets bored", I think you should read Rarefure again so you could see how the pace of the story clearly was and how the supposed NTR element somewhat made sense why it happened in the first place.
